page.title: 06THE LOOP ROAD
page.content: The military 'loop road' on Dartmoor above Okehampton is to be allowed to decay to the point where it would be unusable by private cars. The road is owned by the Duchy of Cornwall, and provides access to the army ranges south of Okehampton Camp. The road is open to the public when the ranges are not in use. In 1983 the Duchy announed that the road would be left to decay by 'benign neglect' and so let the northern moor return to its former isolation. There has been opposition to the idea, as the road provides a unique way onto the moor for the disabled, and those who prefer not to walk. The Town Commoners' Association passed a resolution expressing sorrow that the Prince of Wales had not taken notice of the local wish to maintain one of the most scenic drives in the country.
